Like most Americans, I was sickened by the shooting of two innocent police officers, including a young mother, in their patrol vehicle. It‚Äôs a miracle they are alive today. Heinous, premeditated attacks like this against our law enforcement officers cannot be tolerated. https://t.co/YSQijdiVoi

This was a missed opportunity for a bipartisan achievement, but I‚Äôll keep working with my colleagues to reach compromise and an agreement that will drive our battle against the coronavirus and a strong economic recovery.

Those bipartisan provisions make up the targeted #COVID19 relief bill that I voted for today. Unfortunately, Senate Democrats filibustered this bill, holding out for the $3.5 trillion dollar so-called "HEROES Act," at the direction of Chuck Schumer and Nancy Pelosi.

Over the past 5 weeks, I heard Alaskans' priorities for a new #COVID19 relief bill: renewing the #PaycheckProtectionProgram, extending the deadline to use CARES Act funds, reopening schools safely & supporting our front-line health care workers, among other important measures. https://t.co/BX6FcobG1e

@HHS_ASH Alaska leads the nation in per capita tests. This allocation will build on that success & expand capacity further. I appreciate @HHS_ASH Admiral Giroir for being agile & decisive in getting the resources we need, supporting the exemplary work of our health professionals. [4/4]

I called @HHS_ASH Admiral Brett Giroir, who is leading the nation‚Äôs testing effort, and the federal government is now sending an additional 4,000 Cepheid tests per week to Alaska through the end of September. [3/4]

We know that tests are a vital tool that gives state and local health officials the insights they need to identify potential hotspots and mitigate the spread before the virus can reach larger numbers of Alaskans. [2/4]

This weekend, I met with Alaskans across a spectrum of industries‚Äîincluding tourism & fishing‚Äîwhose livelihoods are at risk due to the #COVID19 pandemic. One concern I heard consistently from every group was about the potential for a shortage of tests in the coming months. [1/4]

On #WorldOceansDay, we recognize the importance of the health of the oceans to our environment, lives & communities. The theme this year is ‚Äúinnovation for a sustainable ocean,‚Äù a worthy focus that‚Äôs also been a top priority of mine since coming to the Senate. #ProtectOurHome

@SenatorSinema @DeptVetAffairs These men and women stepped up and sacrificed on behalf of our country when we needed them most. Our bill will honor their service by making sure the #VA is properly resourced to meet the unique needs of homeless #veterans affected during the pandemic.

@SenatorSinema @DeptVetAffairs Our bill will enable the #VA to offer homeless #veterans additional assistance, including transportation & basic amenities, set up shelters on VA properties, and ensure vets have access to tele-health services.

Yesterday, @SenatorSinema and I introduced legislation that would give the @DeptVetAffairs greater flexibility in caring for homeless #veterans in the midst of the #COVID19 pandemic.
